By the Forest of Death, Team 10 were training when there was a sudden flash, blinding the three of them.

"Ugh... what was that...?" growled Ino, as she regained her bearings.

"Hm... I do not know..." muttered Chouji. "Where did it come from? It appeared to come from the Training Grounds. Perhaps we should investigate."

"U-uh..." mumbled Shikamaru as he pressed his fingers together. "I-I don't know i-if we should... Asuma-sensei m-might get mad if we're not here when he a-arrives..."

Ino simply grinned and placed an arm around Shikamaru's shoulders. "Aw, don't be so worried, Shikamaru! We'll be back in plenty of time!" And with that, she immediately ran in the direction of Team 7.

"W-wait! Ino-chan!" Shikamaru shouted, before running after her. Chouji simply sighed and adjusted his scarf, before slowly following them.

----------

Meanwhile, in near the Hokage Faces, Team 8 were enjoying their day off when they were blinded by the same flash.

"Ah!" shouted Kiba, rubbing his eyes while Akamaru whimpered. "What just happened?"

Shino blinked behind his dark glasses before scratching his head. "I dunno... but did anyone else feel really wierd when that happened?"

Hinata scoffed as she placed her hands in her pockets. "Well, whatever it was, it doesn't matter. If anyone needs me, I'll be at the Training Ground."

"Aw, come on, Hinata..." whined Shino. "Kurenai-sensei gave us the day off, remember?"

"Hmph!" Hinata turned away from them. "You two idiots can mess around all you want; I'm not missing a single minute of training."

And with that she stormed away. Shino's eyes widened, before he furrowed his brow.

"What!? I'm not letting you get ahead of me! I'm gonna train too!" he announced, before running after Hinata.

"Hey!" shouted Kiba, following them with a very girly run. "Wait for me, guys!"

Akamaru watched the spectacle, slightly confused. His master and his friends didn't normally act like that...

Shrugging (as best a dog can), the small puppy ran after his master. Whatever it was, it can't be too important.

1113322211111.content:
Looking over at his team mates, Naruto sees Sasuke standing back boredly, but what draws his attention is his female teammate. Like how he now wore her clothes, she was now dressed in his signature oragne tracksuit, and had her headband tied around her forehead, with her pink hair now rather messy. She was looking down at herself, quite shocked by what she seemed to be wearing currently. She then looked up and noticed Naruto, and when she saw what he was wearing, she looked like she was about to explode in anger at him for wearing her clothes. However, before she could, Sasuke spoke up in a bored tone.

"Well, that was a waste. It didn't do anything." Sasuke said, causing his teammates to stare at him, wondering why he didn't seem to notice what had happened to them.

"Nothing seems different to you?" Sakura asked, dreading what she thought he was about to say.

"Nope. Everything is the same as before you used that jutsu." he replied. "Anyway, I'm heading home." And with that, he turned and headed back to the village.

Naruto and Sakura stood there dumbfounded for a few minutes before Sakura regained her composure and rushed at the blonde. "Alright Naruto, what the hell did you do!? Why are you in my clothes, and why didn't Sasuke notice anything was wrong!?" she demanded as she shook him.

"I don't know! I don't know!" the blonde said repeatedly until she stopped.

"Whatever you did, undo it!" she demaded.

"Uh, right. Well, first, where is that scroll?" he asked. Sakura then noticed she had been holding the scroll, and handed it to him. After looking at how to do it, he did the same hand seals as before, but when he finished, nothing happened. Nervously, he tried again, and even a third time, but nothing happened.

"Here, give me that." Sakura said as she took the scroll from him. Reading it for a second, she did the handsels herself, but still nothing happened. "Why isn't this working!?" She then noticed some writing started to appear near the bottom. Reading it, it said: "This technique only works on a person one a week. After which, the two it was used on switch lives. While it can be used on different people, those who it was used on are stuck like that for an entire week. No one but those who it has been used on will notice any differences, and will be treated by others as the person they have switched with, and they will also switch all abilities and techniques, including bloodlines. This scroll must be present when using this technique." After a few more minutes, the writing disappeared again.

"What'll we do now, Sakura?" Naruto asked her.

"How should I know! This is your fault!" she yelled at him. "Now we're stuck as eachother for a whole week!" After a while, she calms down, and they talk about what they will do with the current situation. After some discussion, they decide to try and live as echother for the week

111332222222211.content:
"Well, that was pointless..." muttered Sasuke bitterly at seeing nothing happen.

Naruto scratched his head in confusion. "But... but I'm certain I did it right..."

"U-um, guys...?" Sakura said in a shaky voice, getting their attention. "I-I feel kinda funny..."

No sooner had the words left Sakura's mouth than her clothes began to change. Her sandals were the first thing to change; the colour shifted from blue to red, matching her dress, as the hole at the front where her toes poked out sealed up. In exchange, the tops of her sandal began to shrink, revealing her ankles and the tops of her feet as the material changed into a harder, shinier substance. Finally, the heels at the back slowly rose up, becoming taller and thinner until Sakura's sandals had completed their transformation into red four-inch stilleto heels.

"Wh-what the!?" Sakura shouted, looking at her new footwear. Naruto blushed immensely at seeing his crush wearing such... risque footwear, while Sasuke's eyes simply widened at the change.

That wasn't the only change however, as Sakura quickly felt her shorts begin to rapidly lengthen and slither down her legs. As they did, the material changed from spandex to nylon, and the colour faded from dark blue to bubblegum pink. The shorts-turned-pantyhose completed their changes by slipping into Sakura's new shoes, completely encasing her feet. As they did, her bra and panties dissappeared

Blushing tremendously, Sakura cried out as she grabbed the front and back of her dress and pulled it down, trying to preserve her modesty that was on display thanks to the sheer material. When she did, however, she felt the two ends merge over her crotch, changing her dress into a sort of leotard. The neckline began to plung as her sleeves shrank and vanished; the white designs vanished as the upper area dissappeared until her shoulders and upper chest were on display. The leotard stiffened as it changed material, pushing her budding breasts upward and giving the illusion that they were bigger while showing off what cleavage she had. A white cotton tail materialised just above Sakura's butt.

As Sakura fearfully felt her new costume, she noticed a white shirt-cuff appear on each of her wrists, held in place with a golden button shaped like the Konoha symbol. She felt a weight on her throat as a matching shirt collar formed with a matching red bowtie. Finally, the headband she wore in her hair shrank into a regular hairband, as two white rabbit ears sprang out of it, completing the transformation.

"Wh-what the hell is this!?" screamed Sakura at seeing her new outfit. She didn't have time to ponder what was happening, as she quickly found her own body moving against her will. Her pantyhose-clad legs took step after step, her hips swaying seductively on their own as she moved towards the two shell-shocked boys. Standing in front of one, she gently leaned forward and kissed him on the lips. It was only for a few seconds, but Sakura blushed bright red as she gave her first kiss away, but more importantly it "passed" the change onto the boy, who would soon also be dressed in a similar outfit.

But who was it she kissed?

While their faces were being madeup, another set of salon staff had gone to work on their hair, putting in extensions and washing it with a variety of women's shampoos. 12.content:
In a dark lab of the Shinigami Research and Development Institute, Captain Mayuri Kurotsuchi looked over a strange and mysterious machine that had recently been uncovered. "And what exactly does this machine do?" he asked a researcher.

"We're not exactly sure. We've tried everything short of activating it to find out what this machine is, and what it does, but nothing has yielded results." the researcher responded.

"Well then, if that is the only way to discover what this thing does, then that is what must be done." he said. "The only question now is where to find the right guinea pigs to test it out."

--

In another part of the Soul Society, Ichigo Kurosaki and friends were walking. He along with Orihine, Uryu, and Chad had recently come to the Soul Society to do some training, and met up with Rukia and Renji. As they made their way to where they planned to do the training, they came to a clearing where they came upon and strange machine.

"What the hell is this thing?" Ichigo asked.

"I don't know. I've never seen anything like it." Rukia said

"What do you think it does?" Orihime asked.

"Don't know. Maybe we should turn it on and find out." Renji suggested.

"I'm not so sure that's such a good idea." Uryu said. "We have no idea what that thing does, so activating it would just be foolish."

"Sounds to me like you're just scared. C'mon, whats the worst that could happen?" the red-haired shinigami asked.

"I am not! For all we know, it could be a bomb! Are you sure you want to be an idiot and activate it without knowing what potential danger it could cause?" the Quincy argued.

"That still sounds like you're scared! And don't call me an idiot!"

"What are you guys doing?" they heard someone ask, interrupting the argument between Uryu and Renji. They looked over and saw the captain and lieutenant of the 10th division, Toushiro Hitsugaya and Rangiku Matsumoto, and the 5th division's lieutenant, Momo Hinamori approach them.

"Oh, hey Toushiro." Ichigo greeted.

"That's Captain Hitsugaya." the boy corrected him for the umpteenth time.

"What's that thing?" Mom asked.

"We don't know; we just found it here." Orihime said.

"I wonder what it does." Rangiku said curiously. "Maybe we should turn it and find out!"

"No! Doing that without knowing what it does will just cause problems!" Uryu tried to reason.

"Aw, come on. What's the worst that could happen?"

"Plenty!" the Quincy stated, irritated that he was having the same arguement for a second time. "You don't know what could happen if you turn it on!"

"But I want to know what it does." she whined. "What do you think captain? Don't you want to know what it does?"

"No." the white haired boy responded. "I agree with him; activating it without knowing what it does would just be stupid, and I'm sure it will just cause trouble."

"Aw, you're no fun! Where's your sense of curiosity?"

"Don't touch it." a voice commanded them, and they turned to the source to see the Captain of the 2nd Division, Soi Fon shunpo in. "That machine was planted there by Captain Kurotsuchi. Knowing him, this is part of some kind of bizarre experiment. The area around that machine is to be quarantined until it can be safely removed."

Uryu gave Renji an 'I told you so' look before saying "Let's get out of here. I have no intention of being part of one of that lunatic's experiments."

Unfortunately for them, the machine had been set with a remote activation device that the mad scientist had planted to activate it himself if the ones who discovered it did not do it. The machine instantly activated before any of them could leave, and there was a blinding flash that engulfed all those present.

13.content:
"Hey, guys! Catch!"

Zoro grunted as he tossed the large heavy chest up onto the Sunny's deck. They had been doing some diving for exercise while they rested in the harbour, and he had found it at the bottom.

"Whoa!" shouted Luffy, as ran over to chest; it was bigger than he was. "It's so huge!"

"Don't get your hopes up, Luffy." chuckled Sanji as he walked over. "Knowing Marimo it's probably full of junk."

Zoro growled and shot the cook a death glare. He was too tired after his swim to bother arguing, though, so he just flipped his middle finger at him and went back to wringing out his shirt.

"Well, what're we waiting for!?" announced Nami, Belli signs already in her eyes. "Open it, open it!"

"Calm down, Nami..." muttered Usopp as he picked the chest's lock. "You've gotta be careful with these things. They could be boobytrapped or anythi..." he was cut off by a loud click. "Got it."

Usopp and Luffy pushed the humongous lid back, revealing a huge variety of gold, jewels, antiques and pretty much everything else of value.

"Whoa!" shouted Chopper, his eyes widening in wonder. "So pretty!"

"It's so shiny..." gasped Brook. "Why, I think it's starting to hurt my eyes! ....except I don't have eyes! Yohohohohoho!"

"You've really outdone yourself, swordsman-san." stated Robin with a smile.

"Yeah, swordsman!" laughed Franky with a thumbs-up. "You did a SUPER job!"

Luffy drooled as he stared at their newfound treasure. However, something quickly caught his eye.

"Hm? What's this?" he asked, as he plucked out some sort of gold amulet from the pile. It was round with a blue jewel in the middle; it didn't seem any different from the piles and piles of jewelry already in the chest. And yet, there was something about it...

Luffy didn't have time to ponder this any further. The amulet immediately reacted to his touch as the jewel glowed, before releasing a blinding light from it that engulfed the entire crew.

"Ah!" shouted Luffy as he attempted to shield his eyes.

"Luffy!" screamed Zoro. "What did you do!?"
13.title: One Piece

131.content: The crew looked over each other, each trying to adjust their eyesight after the blinding light. It slowly died down, and they could finally get a better looks at each other.
131.title: They all change genders.

1312.content:
As far as they could tell, nothing had changed. Everyone was exactly the same as normal.

There was a swift punch to the back of Luffy's skull. "Don't fool around, moron!"

The captain puffed out his cheeks. "Nothing bad happened..."

"And we're lucky for it!" Nami sighed. "I'm taking this somewhere safe. Somewhere you won't mess around with it."

With practiced ease, she swung the jewelry over to Sanji. "Guard this with your life. For me?"

"Ahhhhhh- of course Nami-swan~ Anything for you~"

There was a brief frown on the navigator's face. Something about that felt... different than usual. More annoying.

But she shook her head, dismissing the strange feelings. There was no use worrying.

And one by one, with some light shaming of the captain, the crew went their separate ways. Each felt... a little different from before. They weren't sure what it was but something important had changed.
1312.title: Mental Changes

13121.content:
Usopp was, by nature, an anxious person. He had always felt weak compared to his father. Weak compared to the crew mates. He would never be tough enough or strong enough. He did his best to work around these factors but... it still hurt.

Suddenly, that fear had vanished. Being so weak just... didn't bother him anymore. It wouldn't stop him from working hard, but it felt him feeling far more comfortable than before.

Almost.

Every now and then, he couldn't stop himself from looking in the mirror and feel a profound sense of disappointment. It was several different things. His hair was too messy. His body too lanky. His skin too rough. But worst of all was... the nose. That long, obstructive nose. It had looked nice on his mother. But on him... it was so gross. How could people stand to look at him?

He'd never be cute or beautiful like the others like this. Perhaps... perhaps he could borrow something from Robin that could help.

-----

Zoro's changes were more subtle. He had never been one to care about appearance and that wasn't about to change. His thoughts turned to his childhood. All the remarks about Kuina's womanhood. The certainty that she could be never as strong as the men.

Somehow, it felt so much more infuriating than usual. He began training twice as hard, three times as hard.

He'd show them the power of the greatest swordswoman in the world.

----

Sanji's was more distinct. As he cooked, his movements shifted. Even more refined. Even more careful.

He threw out the smokes. It wasn't proper. He had certain rules to follow. He couldn't go around being so harsh. He needed to be... softer. Sweeter. He had to give love to the crew, love to the big, strong handsome men. Those bastions of masculinity, protecting the weak and fragile.

A woman's touch was exactly what this place needed.

----

Luffy huffed. They didn't have to be so mean...

Chopper was checking on the captain's bruises, making sure they weren't anything serious. He smoothed a band-aid over Luffy's arm. "Should be good at new soon!"

"Alright! Thanks Chopper!" But before the captain could run off to play again, he paused.

"Why this one?" Chopper had drawn a little flower on it.

The doctor looked away, blushing. "I just... thought it was cute."

Luffy considered. "...you're right! It is!"

"Y-yeah?"

"Yeah! Like you!"

"Ohhh- stop it, I hate you, you think I'd fall for compliments like that?!" But he was wobbling around in delight.

The shifts in crew mentality were slow but certain.

1541123.content:
A light wind blew through the window. The sounds of birds chirping and people starting about their day caused a red-haired girl to slowly stir. Ranma Saotome shuffled in her sheets before managing to force herself up. She stretched her arms wide, trying to pop all the kinks in her muscles. She blinked blearily at the light shining in from the window, slowly waking up for the world.

That's strange... Pops usually tries to sneak attack me by now... But she decided to take her blessings where she could as she climbed to her feet. She was too sleepy to pay much attention to her surroundings, but there was a sense of unease in the back of her mind. Something was definitely different about the shared guest room today. For one thing, there wasn't a sight of Genma anywhere. Not even his mat was here. And the room seemed... cleaner than usual. Less of a mess of their typical Saotome laziness.

If she had her full faculties, she might notice that she herself hadn't gotten up from a mat, but a full bed. That her clothes were in a drawer that wasn't there yesterday and weren't quite the same clothes that they were the previous night. But with little more than a yawn, she strolled out the door, heading off to the bathroom. She splashed hot water on her face, waiting patiently for the shift back to manliness.

But it didn't arrive.

A tug of panic gripped her stomach before she brushed off the concern. The water just must not be hot enough. One boiling tea kettle would do the trick. Pushing her fear down, she continued her trek down to the main Tendo dining room.

"Morning," she mumbled as she emerged from the stairs. Nabiki and Soun were invested in different parts of the paper, while Kasumi worked to set down the breakfast. Akane was already munching on some toast with jam.

"Oh, good morning, Ranma-chan." Kasumi smiled brightly at the girl.

"Glad to see you up, my girl!" Soun wasn't far behind her in spirits, chipper as ever.

"Hey." Nabiki as apathetic as always.

But oddest of all was Akane's surprisingly kind smile. There wasn't a trace of her usual anger on her features. "Morning, Ranma." A trace of a smirk crawled up her lips. "You're going to make us late again, sleeping in like that."

She waved her off. "Like it takes long for me to get ready anyway."

Nabiki snorted. "You've barely even washed up. Wouldn't want Kuno to see you make-up-less."

Ranma groaned and shivered. "Don't even joke about that...."

"Well, your uniform is clean and ready for you in the family room."

Uniform? Ranma had never gotten a uniform. Or if he had, he'd quickly lost it. Curious, she peeked into the family room.

Clearly there had to be a mistake. The only male clothes among the laundry was Soun's stuff. "Are you sure, Kasumi? I don't see it."

"Don't be silly, Ranma. Its the third pile, right next to Akane's."

She checked again. Right next to Akane's clothes was a girl's uniform, along with some other skirts and bras and such.

"C'mon Kasumi, stop fooling. There's only girl's stuff here."

There was a few seconds of silence from the kitchen. "...What else would there be, Ranma-chan?"

Ranma could only look between the clothes and kitchen in absolute confusion. Something... something was wrong. Kasumi wouldn't joke about this. Kasumi didn't really joke.

But what the hell was going on? What sort of world did he trip into?
1541123.title: Waking Up In Girl World

choices: Go find the others on your own
15411231.content:
After the initial confusion from certainly had to be the Tendos pulling a trick on her, she marched over to dump a pot of hot water over her head.

Her head. Not "his" head, of course, because she still wasn't changing back.

"Ranma?! What are you doing?!" Kasumi was there in an instant, trying to clean up the girl and the floor. "You've caused such a mess...."

Nabiki snickered to herself. "Really needed to wake up, huh Ranma?"

Akane, once again, surprised Ranma by looking at her with genuine concern. "Is everything okay?"

Ranma could only look at them then back at her hands, brow furrowing. "I'm not changing back."

"Back to what?"

Each Tendo (sans Nabiki of course) were fixing her with looks of concern and alarm. Like she had never dumped hot water on herself before. Like there was nothing for him to transform back into.

And if that was the case, well... explaining a curse might not be the best move right now.

"...Don't worry about it. Just... tired."

One by the one, the Tendos reluctantly accepted the explanation. "Well, hurry up, Ranma. We're gonna be late!"

-----

She tried to sneak away to go investigating. Surely the old hag knew something about this mess. And where was Pops? But Akane was keeping a close hold on her now, insisting Ranma get dressed and ready to go. She was almost ready to force Ranma into the skirt herself if the martial artist hadn't finally relented.

She had been in skirts before, but never the school uniform. And the schoolbag that Akane had accused her of forgetting. It felt like Ranma was stuck on a rail today. No matter what she did to get off the track, she was quickly herded back into the position.

"I don't see why you're in such a big fuss, Akane..."

"Because Kuno and his cronies, of course. You might not care, but I don't want to be carrying buckets in the hall again."

She zeroed in on Akane. Kuno's cronies...? "They're still bugging you?"

Akane laughed. "God, you can't be so strong that you've stopped noticing." But her good cheer vanished, teeth tightening. "Those stupid boys never stop..."

And sure enough, the mass of boys fighting for Akane's attention were waiting for them at the school courtyard. The two girls quickly made short work of them, kicking and punching them aside. Ranma felt her stomach churn. They all had a wolf-like gleam in their eyes. And not all of them were focused on Akane. A good number of them were focused on her too.

One of them tried to grab her ass, so she quickly knocked out her teeth.

They were late, of course, and they had to stand outside in the halls once more. But Akane didn't seem to mind. She was focused on other priorities.

"I can't believe what that creep tried to do to you!" Akane hissed in righteous anger, offended on her behalf.

Ranma growled, staring at the little cracks between the floor tiles. "I don't even want to think about it."

"They normally don't manage to get as close as that..."

She flashed angry eyes at her fiance. "So what, its my fault?"

But Akane didn't engage in her usual banter, shaking her head quickly. "Of course not! I was just worried... you've been off your groove all day..."

She grumbled again, returning her gaze to the floor. "This never would have happened if I was a man."

Akane sighed, looking relieved. "You say that all the time. At least you still sound like yourself."

...That's right. She remembered now. When she first came to the Tendo house, Akane had been nothing but nice to her. It was only when she turned back into a man that Akane started whacking him with hammers and fists and so on.

Was this what would have happened if she had never turned back?

------

It was easy to notice other changes now that she had a theory to work off of. Ranma just had to think of it as a battle. Movements and positions on the board had changed, but once she had it all lined out, everything would come together.

The first noticeable change was Akane. She was nicer than she ever had been before. She practically doted over Ranma, walking everywhere together. Even when she tried to start an argument like before, Akane just let it roll off her like it wasn't a big deal. To this Akane, Ranma was a fellow martial artist who she'd trained with and lived with for ages.

The second change was the other classmates. Boys would eye her from a distance, while girls practically fawned over her. No longer was Ranma the potential pervert who Akane was stuck with. Ranma and Akane were local heroes, for fighting off the all too eager boys and the dangerous likes of Happosai.

Nabiki and Kuno were roughly unchanged. Ranma supposed that for them, business and obsessive love were the only things they could focus on.

But as far as she could tell, there wasn't any sign of Shampoo and Ryoga. Ranma tried testing Akane's memory, but only Shampoo sparked a reaction.

"Ugh, hopefully she's still out of town. I don't want to deal with the likes of her anytime soon."

So Shampoo hadn't been around in a while. Had she still been cursed? Or did she have no reason to train at Jusenkyo if she never learned Ranma was really a man? And where the hell did Pops get off to?

With the end of the school day, Ranma once again found herself in a position of freedom. Akane swung around her schoolbag casually. "Anything you wanted to do? We could hit the ice cream parlor again."

Ranma tried to egg her on one last time. "It could be nice to sweet talk my way into free treats."

But simply Akane rolled her eyes. "I'll never understand how you're this shameless."
15411231.title: A world with permanent curses

choices: ... giggled politely. "That'd be if one of us was a boy, silly?"
... blushed madly. "Yeah, technically, b-but we're both girls!"
... blinked in confusion. "Of course we are. Why'd you ask?"
154112311.content:
Ranma gave it a good ten seconds as Akane walked away. Things were unfamiliar, and she didn't quite know when or if she'd be back if she looked for some familiar faces. Anyways, being with Akane like this was... nice, in a way.

"Yeah, why not?"

Akane stopped short when she heard these words. Ranma sidled up to her, arms behind her head in typical fashion.

But her casual intent was completely ignored by Akane. Ranma went rigid when she felt a monstrous strength encircle itself around her and spin her around.

Akane was up and ahead of her in a few seconds with a cheery gait, almost dragging the dizzy Ranma after her.

~~~


To Ranma’s delight, the store Akane had taken her to was familiar — the parlor where she had eaten her first sundae. Happy at one of the few good things to happen today, she excitedly ordered a Strawberry Supreme as Akane ordered Death by Chocolate with a smile on her face.

After finding a booth to sit in and giving a quick thanks, both of the girls started to dig in to their respective sundaes — one a bit more messily than the other.

Their conversation was brief, but nice. Topics mostly drifted around stupid boys at school, and went into some fighting talk from there. Ranma was a little surprised — she knew Akane could hold her own in a fight, but she could articulate her techniques surprisingly well

Conversation died down, however, when Akane spied Dr. Tofu out the window. Ranma sullenly spooned ice cream into her mouth as Akane made googly-eyes at the doctor.

‘She never looked at me like that before...’ Ranma pouted to herself, the embers of jealousy still smoldering in this strange new world.

A thought popped up in Ranma’s head. The distraction sent the icecream down the wrong pipe, sending her into paroyxsms of coughing. Akane’s concern actually did draw her away from her sporadic crush.

“You okay?” Akane had moved over to Ranma’s side of the booth, tapping her back in case the coughs started up again.

“Yeah, I’m good. I just was thinkin’...” Ranma trailed off, unsure of what to say.

“Thinking about what?”

Ranma nervously steepled her fingers, not sure how to ask her question.

“Uh, didn’t, um, our dads’, uh, agree to, uh, join their school together a long time ago?”

Akane tilted her head in confusion. “Yeah, I think so.”

'Gah, she doesn't get it!'Ranma gritted her teeth and expelled what she was thinking in one breath.

“Doesn’tthatmeanwe’refiancesorsomething?”

Akane drew a little back in surprise, and…
154112311.title: Stick with Akane

1541123112.content:
Akane was almost as red as an apple, sputtering anxiously. Ranma couldn't blame her- bringing it up under these conditions made her face feel a bit like a tomato.

"Y-Yeah, technically, b-but we're both girls!" She waved a hand frantically, as if trying to desperately wave the comment away from the air itself. "I- I mean it just wouldn't be- erm- done! There's no way our fathers would put us through that, s-so... why bring it up?"

Ranma kept her gaze as far away from Akane as possible. It wasn't like he liked the dumb tomboy anyway, so why did he still care about all this? If anything, this new curse nonsense was a temporary reprieve from Akane's moaning.

She quickly searched for a deflection. "Well, you... haven't met Pops." Which was still a weird concept to wrap her mind around. "He'd do anything to keep the family name going."

He could sense Akane sweating and hear her gulp. "Thank goodness he hasn't shown yet... I guess I shouldn't be surprised, if he was Happosai's student but to go that far..."

A familiar anger boiled in Ranma's stomach. He had always struggling to ignore it and the temptation to lean towards the familiar was all too enticing at the moment.

"Well, sorry for being so unappealing..."

"What?"

"No, forget it, if marrying me is too far, maybe we shouldn't even risk eating together!"

Akane's own eyebrows narrowed. "You've been moody and weird all day. I don't know what's going on with you but-"

"I said forget it. Who'd wanna marry a tomboy like you anyway?"

Dammit. When would he learn to keep his trap shut? He dreaded looking over to see her reaction...
1541123112.title: "But we're both girls!"

choices: A little black piglet snuffling around the trash.
A fully human Ryoga, roasting fish over a fire — he was lost again.
A blue kitten meowing in front of the building that used to be the Cat Cafe.
Shampoo handing out flyers in front of her family's Cafe.
154112312.content:
"I'll meet up with you later, actually." After school would probably be the best time to snoop around.

Akane just let her go, a small shrug the only pause she gave before heading on her way. This seemed to be a usual occurrence for the Tendo girl. Ranma watched her walk off a bit before

Before she started a search, Ranma took a walk in the park to clear her head a bit. Whatever normalcy that Akane's presence granted was gone, and the sense of unease started to blossom into anxiety, gnawing in her gut.

Besides her current form, things weren't exactly unpleasant — excepting the band of perverts in the courtyard — but everything was just wrong enough to be uncomfortable. Pa and Happosai weren't the best to have around, yet it was just... quieter without them. It was nice to not have to fight Kuno every time the wannabe Casanova saw Akane and her together, but she was greeted with a metric ton of love letters from him every time she opened her shoe locker. She didn't have to contend with Ryoga and Shampoo, but...

A cold chill ran across her back as she connected the pieces. A world where she was always a girl. There wasn't a single person wondering if she was a man. So, then, what could've happened to Shampoo and Ryoga?

Ranma would've never considered herself a good Samaritan, but something about their potential situation made her stomach churn. At least she was human! Steeling her eyes, she resolved to start a search campaign.

~~~


The next few hours did not bear much fruit. Asking guys from Furikan usually resulted in them shuffling around for a couple of minutes, their eyes occasionally shifting down to 'appraise' her, sending nausea clinging at her throat. She stopped asking them after a few wanted to exchange 'puff-puffs' for information and instead left them with black eyes.

Girls were by far easier to talk with but yielded the same result. At least they had the decency to look sad after admitting to not seeing a black piglet or a blue kitten.

Hours later, the sun was setting, and Ranma was beat. Even her normally inexhaustible supply of stamina was flagging after the day she had, and bed seemed a wonderful alternative to exerting herself further.

Stretching her arms behind her head, she turned the corner into a shortcut she hadn't used in a while.

But to her surprise, she was greeted with success, rather than a shorter way home.

She saw...
154112312.title: Go find the others on your own

1541123121.content:
Sure enough, a little black piglet was digging his way through some trash. And as if she needed that final confirmation, a familiar bandana had been firmly tied around him.

As quick as she could, she lifted up the little guy from the ground. Ryoga immediately started squirming in a panic, BWEEEing incessantly.

"Ryoga! Relax! It's me! Ranma!"

The pig stopped at the name drop, turning to fix Ranma with a curious squint. She could almost see the slow gears struggling to move forward.

"C'mon, don't tell me you forgot about our battle. You kept me waiting for days!"

That finally did the trick. With the final penny drop, the pig's eyes light up in a rage. With a fearsome BWEEEE, he leapt from Ranma's grip in a flawed attempt at an attack.

She couldn't deny it though, the biting hurt.

"Hey! Would y- ow! Would you relax?! I'm just trying to- OW! Quit it!

---------

It took a lot of doing to get Ryoga to relax. She had to let him think he was winning a battle before he began to let up. He was so sensitive: the slightest thing would set him off. But more importantly, the pattern was holding. Ryoga couldn't turn back in hot water either.

In due time, she managed to sit him down at a table in the ice cream shop. Other girls smiled and fawned over the famed Ranma and her pet, much to both of their displeasure. But once their food had been acquired, Ranma got to work. Ryoga watched in irritated fascination as Ranma scibbled letters on notebook paper. Satisfied, she set it down before him. Very letters and words in English and Japanese were laid out.

"Alright, here's how we'll do this. You ever used a Ouija board?"

The pig shook his head.

"Well..." She tapped her finger on an English P. "All you gotta do is point to the letter or word you want to say. So P C H A N for P-Chan, right?"

Another frustrated BWEE.

"Oh pipe down. It's a way to talk, isn't it?"

The pig rolled his little eyes before quickly taking to the paper, hopping on each letter he required. Ranma leaned in eagerly.

"R-A-N-M-A-S-A- oh for pete's sake- yeah, it's me, Ranma Saotome."

The pig glared again, continuing his hops.

"Y-O-U-W-I-L-L-P-A-Y-F-O- look, Ryoga, I get it, I'll pay for hurting your honor or whatever, is this really the time for this?"

The pig continued unabated in his long speech before Ranma finally picked him up to frantic BWEEEs.

"Focus on the priority here! Both of us are stuck like this and we need to find a way out. We can fight later!"

Even with the BWEEs, Ranma had known his rival long enough to pick up on certain intentions and feelings. The man wore his heart on his... pigskin.

"We need an equal battle, right? So you gotta get back to normal first. It's not fair otherwise."

Ryoga bweed a quiet grumble, but the words seemed to have an effect. Satisfied, Ranma set him back down.

"Then we're agreed. Then I need to check something: when you challenged me to our first battle, what gender was I?"

The pig gave him the most confused look Ranma had ever seen. Which was saying something, considering Nerima.

"Just answer, okay? I need to figure out how this curse works."

Annoyed, Ryoga got to hopping. M-A-N.

Good. That meant before Jusenkyo, people still remembered he was a man.

"Okay. Then what do you remember after that? With the curse and onward."

Ryoga looked down at the page warily, already dreading having to hop so many times. Ranma leaned back with her ice cream, patiently watching his story unfold.
1541123121.title: A little black piglet snuffling around the trash.

choices: “You’re usually way more excited for her outfits”
“Normally you’d’ve complained a lot more ‘bout your mom by now”
She’s interrupted by Nodoka whisking Ranma away to meet… her fiance?!
15411233.content:
Ranma rifled each pile of clothes in desperation, a growing sense of unease bubbling up in her as she threw each unrecognized item over her shoulder.

The Tendos watched bemusedly, only pausing to catch their respective bits of clothing as they sailed through the air.

Akane sidled up towards the pigtailed girl, not quite sure how to deal with the situation. Ranma stood practically motionless in front of the last two pieces of clothing she hadn’t thrown.

“Um, Ranma? You doing alright there?”

Ranma slowly turned towards her, a mixture of disgust and horror on her face. Her attention wasn’t fully on Akane, but on the content of her hands.

It was a bra, bright pink, covered in lace, glitter, and at least four different shades of pink. Small butterflies were embroidered on the front of the cups, and, worst of all, it had the name ‘Ranma’ stenciled on the inside in a flowing, feminine script.

Words finally came to Ranma’s lips. “It’s so, so…” Her mouth opened and closed in sheer shock, all the assorted curses she learned came to mind. Her grip slowly tightened on the clothes, her knuckles turning white as her face turned red. “It’s so —!”

Akane cut her off. “Yeah, I get it, it’s not your color, but your mom insisted.” A nervous expression made its way onto her face. “Speaking of which, you should get dressed and made up — we’ll clean this up before sh—”

Akane’s panicked rant was interrupted by a familiar voice. “Oh dear, what’s all this?”

“Oh, god no.” Akane groaned. Quickly maneuvering Ranma slightly out of view of the doorframe, the two girls peeked out the door, Ranma’s face reflecting frank bemusement, Akane’s resigned acceptance.

Gentle footfalls accompanied by a heavy thunk echoed throughout the house. Through the doorway, Ranma could see a slim figure carrying a conspicuously long covered package. Ranma squinted, trying to make out the person — wait, did Akane say ‘your mom?’

Nodoka stopped at the table, shooting a warm smile at the three remaining Tendos there, Soun returning a slightly nervous grin, Kasumi almost perfectly reflecting the pleasant expression, and Nabiki giving a nominal wave. “Good morning, all. I’m quite sorry for sleeping in — I stayed up quite late making a new outfit~!”

She held up two pieces of clothing that were only barely recognizable as a Furinkan High School — the white shirt had various faux-gemstones embedded into the white shirt, accompanied by a small unicorn patch on the back. The skirt was shortened to mid thigh, the bottom notably more ‘ruffled’ than the standard. Everyone gaped in horror, sans Nabiki, who gave an amused smirk.

Soun was the first to speak up, the trembling of his held newspaper belying his nerves. “S-say, Nodoka, isn’t that a bit… much for school?”

Nodoka simply responded with a light giggle, letting the long package rest in the crook of her arm. “No need to worry, Soun-san, I cleared it with Kuno-san. He said it was just like what they wore in Hawaii, so I just had to sit through one of his presentations on bowl-cuts.”

Soun swallowed anxiously, but pressed forward regardless. “Well, I meant to say, shouldn’t you let Ranma decide for herself…?”

Nodoka only tilted her head lightly in confusion. “My, my Soun-san, you know I can’t do that.” She walked towards the laundry room, seemingly leaving it at that. Soun’s white-knuckled grip loosened on his paper, a large sigh of relief leaving his body.

Then Nodoka whirled around, the cloth around her parcel unwinding, and Soun’s face paled. “I, um, quite understand, Saotome-san, there’s no need to—!”

But Nodoka paid him no mind, and started to unsheath the family katana. “It was fourteen years ago, when Ranma-chan was a cute little baby.” She fumbled when pulling out the blade, accidentally leaving the blade piercing the floor, much to Soun’s dismay.

“Although Genma and I were happy together, we knew there must be a heir to the Anything Goes school!” She half-mindedly yanked the blade out of the ground and sliced it to her side, tearing a large hole in the rice-paper wall. Ranma watched the not-quite-familiar display with dread fascination, a ball of trepidation squirming in her gut.

“I begged Genma to take us with him, but he refused. ‘It’s too dangerous for women,’ he said, and I knew in my heart of hearts that he was right.” Tears sprung to Nodoka’s eyes, and her next wild movement sent the tip of the blade right through Soun’s newspaper, turning his ashen face into a bright white.

“And so I swore that I would raise Ranma to be the most womanly woman, or else…” She accidentally let go of the katana mid-flail, sending it soaring directly into the laundry room door, inches away from Ranma, eliciting a short but loud squawk of fear.

“... we would commit seppuku together, having failed as a wife and daughter!” The last words of Nodoka spurred Ranma to hasty action as she desperately searched for the dropped underwear with Akane’s assistance.

Her reverie over, Nodoka only now seemed to realize the swathe of destruction she had caused, not to mention the katana she had left embedded in the laundry room door. She lifted a hand to her mouth in concern. “Oh dear. I’m quite sorry for the mess, Soun — I’ll be sure to repair it later today.”

Soun merely responded with a shaky thumbs up, his breath still taken away.

Giving a small bow of thanks, Nodoka walked over to the laundry room door and pulled out the katana in one fell swoop. “Ranma-chan, are you there? I have a new outfit for you~!”

Before she could do it herself, the door was flung open, revealing Ranma clad in the garishly pink underwear, one leg bent up at a feminine angle and displaying two ‘v’ signs next to a wide smile. “Hiiiiiyaaa, mama~!”

Ranma was nothing if not adaptable.

Nodoka clapped her hands together in delight. “Oh, wonderful! I have your outfit for today all set out, could you put it on while I make a bento?”

Ranma’s smile dropped a few notches. Maybe not that adaptable.


~~~


Ranma stomped along the route to school, a light dusting of red, and sullen expression on her face. She hated the itchy feeling of the embroidered patch on her back, the sequins on her bra digging into her skin, and especially the swishing of the skirt around her thighs.

She had worn girly stuff before, but it didn’t feel like she had to, and the whole able-to-turn-back thing served as a small degree of separation. Most people in Furinkan didn’t know it was her, but now — as evidenced by the half-hidden giggles of girls she passed and the gross feeling of guys openly leering — this was a common sight. But now she was trapped with a mom who’d probably slice off her head and her own if she was caught fighting, and (as evidenced by quick experiments she conducted when no one was looking) she couldn’t turn back.

A hand on her shoulder interrupted her train of thought. She whirled around, only to be met with the concerned face of Akane, softening her scowl a bit. “Hey, you dropped this.” Akane held a small purple compact in her hand, sending Ranma’s mouth curling back down in displeasure. She took the proffered object and shoved it back in her school bag, again stomping along the path.

At least Akane meant well, even if she was still reminding her of all the weird girly stuff that Nodoka apparently enforced. Still, there seemed like there was an invisible barrier between them, a lack of familiarity that they had before. She was way nicer than before, sure, but something felt like it was missing.

Almost as if she was reading her mind, Akane spoke up.

“Is everything alright? _____.”

15511.content:
After finally admitting their love for one another, Inuyasha and Kagome decided to take a few days for themselves. They were currently on their way to a small remote town in the mountains where they would spend a few days relaxing in hot springs.

"You know what Inuyasha?" said Kagome in her usual happy tone.

"What?" replied Inuyasha in his annoyed tone.

"Come on you're supposed to guess."

"No."

"Fine, I'll tell you. I am so glad that it is just you and I."

"What tired of having Miroku's hand on your a-"

"Sit Boy!" Inuyasha was then slammed into the ground thanks to the cursed beads around his neck. However, Kagome didn't know that the ground they were on was unstable. Suddenly, the ground around Inuyasha's hole gave way, taking Kagome with it. Thankfully the hole was only five feet deep so neither Inuyasha or Kagome were hurt.

As the smoke cleared, Kagome''s hand came to rest on something. It felt smooth and structured unlike the broken rocks and shifting dirt around her. Turning, Kagome found an odd box. It was wooden with golden borders and looked like it had been buried for years.

"Kagome you okay?" asked Inuyasha who was finally allowed to lift his head up.

"Yeah I'm fine. Look what I found." Crawling over to her, Inuyasha noted the box.

"What is that?"

"I don't know I just found it." Opening the box up, Kagome found an old book. Opening the book, Kagome found page after page of old chinese characters.

"Can you read any of it?" asked Inuyasha as he stood up.

"Not a bit," answered Kagome as she followed Inuyahs'a example.

"Well bring it along, we might be able to find someone in town who could possibly read it." Inuyasha then hoped out of the hole and then helped Kagome out.

155111.content:
A few hours later, night was beginning to set in with no sign of the town in sight.

"Well this is just great," said a frustrated Kagome. "It's dark out. No town in sight! And I'm covered in Dirt!"

"What's the big deal?" said Inuyasha. "It's just a bit of dirt. I sometimes really don't understand you humans sometimes."

"Well sometimes I can't understand demons!" said Kagome angrily.

Inuyasha just shrugged he was too tired to care and honestly just wanted to sleep. The two eventually decided to make a small camp off the side of the road. Inuyasha managed to make a fire before curling up and falling asleep. Kagome, unhappy that she was still covered in dirt, found it harder to sleep. Then she remembered the book. Taking it out of her bag, Kagome began to thumb through the pages seeing if there was anything that stood out that she might be able to understand. After half an hour of trying, Kagome, in further frustration, slammed the book down on the ground, balled up her fist, hit one of the opened pages, and then flopped onto her side. She was tired, dirty, and unhappy. She just wanted to sleep. And soon she did, oblivious to the light glimmer that came from the book.

1551111221.content:
As Kagome rose, she felt sore all over, groggy, and tired. The sun still had not rose yet as the half moon was still setting. "Stupid rocky ground," Kagome exclaimed, sweeping away pebble and debris under her as she rose. As she scratched her head, her nails felt sharper than normal. "Ow... Just because I wander about in the wilderness is no excuse to let myself go." she utters, rummaging for her nail file in her backpack. As she searches, it felt like the chirping birds were getting louder and clearer, the smell of the flowers sharper and sharper, and the stitching detail of her backpack more and more acute. "Here it is!!" Kagome chirps, overjoyed to find her file. A few rays start encroaching on the horizon, only a few minutes from sunrise.

While looking down to file her pointy nails, she notices three red stripes on her outer thighs. "Great!! The ground must have been harder than I though, and now I have marks on my legs..." With this exclamation, Inuyasha starts to wake. "Kagome, could you keep your complaining until after breakfast... Wait, I smell something strange..."

"What is it, Inuyasha..." Kagome utters just as the sun rises, and a peculiar ripping sound startles her, followed by sensations few a new alien appendage. Inuyasha stares blanky at Kagome, then stutters, "K-K-K-Kagome, I w-w-wouldn't look behind you if I were you..." Kagome did, and promptly fainted.

Forty-five seconds later, Inuyasha splashed some water on Kagome, successfully waking her. Kagome screams, "INUYASHA, WHY DO I HAVE A TAIL, AND WHY IS IS PINK?!" Kagome grabs the appendage, which has ripped a hole in her panties and lifting the rear of her skirt up, and thrusts it at Inuyasha.

Inuyasha holds up a mirror and says, "That's not all that's pink." Kagome looks and sees her originally black hair was now a cherry blossom pink as well. After some well understood initial screaming, Kagome looked herself over. She now sported pointed fingernails and toenails, which by accident she realized she could extend to dagger-like lengths and retract to her original human size, a total of twelve red stripes on her, three on each thigh, and three on each shoulder, shiny irises (which were still green), pointier teeth, and of course, her pink hair and pink furred tail, which resembled a cat's tail. "I don't know what happened, Kagome, for some reason you smell like a half-demon now, a cat demon to be exact. Something or someone must have cursed you overnight, almost as though they overheard our argument, but I don't know how they did it without me sensing them."

Kagome seems to off in her own nervous breakdown, blurting, "Maybe this is a nightmare!! Maybe if I pinch myself I'll wake up!!" She pinches herself on the tip of her tail to find it disturbingly sensitive, quickly gripping and nursing it. "Aaaaauuuuggghhh!!! Oooww!!! Not a dream, not a dream!! I never knew tails were this sensitive!!" She looks at Inuyasha, exclaiming, "Inuyasha, what am I going to do?! I can't go home like this!!"

Inuyasha answers, "Actually, I do remember those things called 'hair dye' in your time when you drug me out shopping, and the stripes are easy enough to hide, and oddly enough even though you're half-demon you still have human-shaped ears. It'd just be a matter of hiding the tail..."

"Sit, boy!!" Inuyasha goes splat into the dirt. "That's not what I mean!! I don't want to worry if my tail is lifting my skirt up or not or not for the rest of my life, I just want to be a normal human girl again!!"

"Alright, alright... We'll figure this out. In the meantime, let's wait for for Miroku and Sango to return..."

1553121212222221.content: Lets try this scenario: One morning in the Human World, DemiVeemon wakes up to find a special stone coming out of Davis' computer. When he touches it, he Digivolves into Veemon, so he can better use the stone, and then he decides to have some fun with it...

choices: Veemon puts on the T-shirt and boxers, before observing Davis some more
Veemon doesn't put on the clothes yet; he's more interested in observing Davis
15531212122222211.content:
DemiVeemon stretched and yawned. He had just woken up from a very pleasant dream, involving a thirty-foot tall stuffed Thanksgiving turkey, just for him. He yawned again and looked around the room.

Ever since the Digidestined had defeated MaloMyotismon just a few months ago, his partner, Davis, had actually matured a little. Before that, his room was usually quite messy; with old chips bags, some dirty laundry, ect. just laying everywhere. Now, his room was relatively clean; the only things laying around now being his clothes.

Speaking of Davis, he was currently still sleeping on his bed, snoring up a storm. Davis' newfound maturity had also extended to his attire; instead of the yellow pajamas he used to sleep in, he now slept in a white T-shirt and a pair of dark blue boxers.

Looking down at his partner, DemiVeemon thought: 'Ever since MaloMyotismon bit the dust, Davis has been more chipper than ever. He doesn't even slack off as much in school now. He's really enjoying everything he can.'

DemiVeemon sighed. 'You know, it must be nice being a human. Going to school, playing soccer, hanging out with your friends...' He sighed again. 'Sometimes, I really wish that I could be a human, like Davis.'

Any further thoughts from DemiVeemon were interrupted, because at that moment, the screen on Davis' computer started to glow.

'Hey, what's with the lightshow?' thought DemiVeemon, as something came out of the computer screen. When the light died down, DemiVeemon saw what it was. It looked like some sort of shiney star-shaped stone.

'What the heck is this thing?' thought DemiVeemon, as he reached out to touch it. The moment that he did touch it, he could feel himself getting stronger and bigger. When the feelings stopped, he had digivolved into Veemon!

'What is going on here?' thought Veemon. 'How did I suddenly digivolve without Davis' help?' Veemon spun around to see if Davis had noticed anything. He hadn't. Davis was the kind of guy who could almost only be woken by his alarm clock. In fact, a herd of stampeding elephants could have passed right by him, without waking him up.

Turning back towards the stone, Veemon reached for it, thinking: 'Now, what exactly are you?' When he touched it this time, he could feel his mind being filled with information about the stone. Appearently, it was known as a Change Stone, an ancient artefact from the Digital World, that allowed the user to swap/change/modify pretty much everything one could think of, by simply pointing it at whomever they wanted to swap with and then thinking about what they wanted to change between both themselves and/or others. They could even decide if others would notice any of the changes that were made, or not.

When he regained his bearings, he held the stone up to his face, going over all of the new information in his head.

'So, this thing is called a Change Stone,' thought Veemon, as he studied it more carefully. As he mentally went over the functions of the Stone, he smiled as realization dawned on him.

'This is perfect! This is why it caused me to digivolve; so I could used this thing easier!' thought Veemon, as he held the stone in his right hand. 'Thanks to this little humdinger, I can not just become a human like Davis; I can actually BECOME Davis!!!'

Turning towards his still sleeping partner, Veemon aimed the Change Stone at Davis and prepared to use the Stone.

Just before Veemon could use the Stone, a thought occured to him.

'Wait a minute...' he thought, pausing with his hand loosely holding the stone. 'I can't swap bodies with Davis; I don't know the first thing about actually BEING a human! Sure, I know that the Stone can alter reality to make it seem normal, but even so, other people might get suspicious if I end up acting more like a Digimon than a human.'

Lowering his hands, Veemon started to think things through.

'Of course, I could just swap knowledge of how to be human with Davis, but that would be too easy. I want to experience being a human, while still being 'me' mentally and keeping things otherwise normal. Hmmm..... what to do?'

Suddenly, an idea popped into his head. 'I've got it! I'll simply make due with just swapping one aspect of being a human, between Davis and me! That way, I can get used to that one thing, before I swap another! Yeah, that's it!'

Veemon once more looked over at the sleeping Davis.

'Now, what human aspect should I swap with Davis?' Veemon thought long and hard about this. Finally, he thought he had an answer. 'What about if I swap clothes between Davis and me and make it so no one notices? Wearing clothes is something that I've never tried, so that would be something I would have to get used to. Plus,' Veemon sniggered, 'watching Davis go about his day in the nude, without anyone finding it weird, is just too funny to pass up!'

'Yeah, I think getting used to wearing clothes takes priority over other things,' decided Veemon. Aiming the Stone once more at Davis, Veemon got ready to make the changes. However, before he could, another thought occured to him.

'Hold on! According to the information about the Stone, if I choose to swap clothes with Davis, then I'll get Davis' clothes. The problem is, that the clothes will be altered to suit me perfectly. That won't do! I want to become a human, sure, but I don't want that drastic a change right now. If I want to get used to wearing human clothes, then I shouldn't alter them. Otherwise, they would be Digimon clothes instead of human clothes. Besides, it just wouldn't be as funny! No, I'll have to think of a way to get it as I want it.'

Veemon thought hard about his little dilemma for about five minutes. Then he got an idea to how he could get it as he wanted. He then aimed the Change Stone at Davis and thought about what specifically he wanted to swap between him and Davis. When the flash from the swap died down, nothing appeared to have been changed; Davis was still sleeping soundly in his bed, still wearing his clothes and Veemon was still standing on the desk, pointing the Change Stone at Davis. But Veemon really had swapped something.

Veemon had chosen that nothing should change physically after the swap, including not altering the clothes, but that the clothes should still belong to him and that no one would find it strange. That way, the clothes all stayed at their regular size, yet they all now belonged to Veemon!

Lowering his arm, Veemon heard Davis' alarm clock ringing. 'Whew, just in time!' thought Veemon, as Davis began to stir. 'Now, if all went according to plan, even though they are still human-sized, Davis should think that all of his clothes are really mine now.'

As Davis sat up, groggy from having just woken up, Veemon thought: 'Perhaps I should call Davis out on him wearing 'my' clothes and see his reaction! Then again, it just might be funnier, if he was allowed to notice it himself!'

While Davis was streching out, Veemon came to a decision.

'Nah, why wait?' he thought. 'I'm curious to see if that rock actually worked!'

Davis was in the middle of a yawn, when Veemon put his plan into effect.

'Here goes nothing,' he thought, before he exclaimed: "Davis!!!"

Davis, still groggy, looked over at him.

"Whassup, Veemon?" he drawled. "How'd you digivolve?"

"Never mind that!" exclaimed Veemon. He thought: 'I hope that Stone worked,' before he continued pretend-yelling at Davis: "Would you mind telling me why you are wearing my clothes?!"

"What're you talking about Veemon?" said Davis sleepily. When Veemon simply pointed down in response, Davis looked down at himself. It took a few seconds for him to properly register everything, but when he did, he jumped up with a yelp of shock, all traces of tiredness completely vanished.

"Aaaaahh!!! You're right Veemon!" exclaimed Davis. "How did I end up wearing your clothes?!?"

'What do you know; that Stone-thingy worked!' thought Veemon to himself exitedly, while out loud, he pretended to still be angry at Davis, by yelling: "I don't care how you got them on, just get them off, now!"

"O-of course, Veemon!," stuttered Davis, as he frantically began to take off the T-shirt and boxers.

Although Veemon looked angry on the outside, on the inside he was doing cartwheels out of excitement. 'It really worked!' he thought. 'Thanks to that Change Stone, Davis' clothes are now all mine and no one finds it weird at all!'

By this point, Davis had managed to take off both the white T-shirt and the dark blue boxers, leaving him completely in the nude. Still pretending to be slightly miffed at him, Veemon said: "Now, could you please explain to me why you were wearing my clothes in the first place?"

"I honestly have no idea, Veemon," said Davis. "I'm certain that I went to bed as normal last night; so I don't know why I was suddenly wearing your clothes."

'I know why,' sniggered Veemon mentally.

"Well, we can figure out how this happened later; I have to get ready for school," said Davis and as he threw the T-shirt and the boxers over to Veemon, who caught them, he added: "You'd better hurry and get dressed, Veemon.'

"Me?"

"Well, duh! They are your clothes after all!" said Davis and crossed his arms. "Besides, it just wouldn't be decent of YOU to stroll around naked, even inside the house. Don't you remember the time when you tried to go out naked like me, and you were almost arrested for it?"

"Oh, right! I forgot!" Veemon played along. But secretly, he was impressed with just how much the Change Stone had altered reality.

"Now, hurry up and get your clothes on, Veemon; I have to get ready for school," said Davis, still buck-naked, before he walked into the kitchen, leaving Veemon, still holding the T-shirt and boxers, alone in his room.

What happens next?
15531212122222211.title: Starting the story...

choices: The T-shirt and the boxers; he wants to get used to wearing clothes gradually
One of the other two outfits
155312121222222112.content:
Veemon stood for a minute, still holding the T-shirt and the boxers.

'Should I really put these on now?' he thought. 'Thanks to the Change Stone altering reality like I wanted it, all of Davis' clothes have become mine now, so I suppose I should put them on.'

Veemon thought more about it, before he made a decision.

'Nah, it can wait,' he thought, letting the clothes fall to the floor. 'I'd rather observe Davis as much as possible before he leaves for school. I don't want to miss one moment of this funny situation. I can put on the clothes once Davis leaves.'

Veemon walked over to the door and peeked out. He had to cover his mouth with his hands, so he wouldn't end up laughing loudly at what he saw.

Davis was sitting buck-naked at the kitchen table, eating his usual breakfast cerial. Veemon of course knew that this was normal for Davis in this altered reality, but that didn't stop it from being funny.

'Amazing!' thought Veemon. 'Davis is just going about his morning rutine as always, exept that he's now naked and he thinks that's perfectly normal for him! This is hilarious!!!' Veemon had to really restrain himself from bursting out laughing. 'It's a good thing that Davis and I are the only ones here at the moment; otherwise I'd never be able to get away with spying on him like this, even with the altered reality.'

Indeed, Davis and Veemon were currently the only two individuals in the apartment. Davis' mom and sister were out of town at the moment, visiting a sick aunt of theirs. Surprisingly, Davis had actually managed to follow the instructions that his mother had left quite well, even as far as the food went.

Speaking of food, Davis had finished eating his cerial. He walked over to the dishwasher and put his plate in it. Veemon then observed the naked Davis walking across the room and entering the bathroom. Judging from the sounds coming from in there, Davis was in the middle of brushing his teeth.

'I still can't believe it,' thought Veemon, still trying his best not to laugh. 'Davis is walking around completely naked and he doesn't find anything odd about it at all! That Change Stone is really impressive!'

Veemon ducked back inside Davis' room, when he heard Davis finishing up in the bathroom. A few moments later, Davis walked in.

"Whoa, Veemon!" he said when he saw his partner. "How come you're still not dressed yet?"

"Er... Just haven't decided on what outfit I should wear, I guess," fibbed Veemon. He found it harder and harder to bite back the laughter, but he managed it.

"Well, just don't take too long," said Davis, as he found his school-books and made to put them in his backpack. "I don't want to come home and find that the police arrested you for 'public indecency', Veemon."

At those words, Veemon had to quickly cover both his mouth and nose with his hands, to prevent a laughing-fit, although he still let out a definite snort of laughter. Davis didn't notice however, as he was busy staring at something in his backpack.

"What's up, Davis?" asked Veemon.

Davis looked at Veemon with a slightly guilty expression and said: "Uh... Veemon? I swear, I have no idea how it happened, but..." He then pulled out several things from the backpack; a red T-shirt with a white number '18' on the back of it, a white pair of shorts with a red stripe down the side, long white socks with a red stripe near the top, and a pair of red, white and black sports-shoes. It was Davis' soccer uniform.

Davis continued: "Honestly , Veemon, I don't know how your soccer clothes ended up in my backpack."

"My soccer clothes?" Veemon was confused. "But, I don't play soccer."

"Duh, of course not!" said the naked Davis as he put on the backpack. "But, you do like to wear them at all of my soccer matches, right? So you can better 'get into the spirit of the game'! Those were your words, right?"

"Right, right, of course! I was just messing with you," lied Veemon. He seemed casual enough, but as soon as Davis turned away from him, Veemon had to grab one of the pillows from the bed and giggle into it. The whole situation was becoming so ridiculous, that Veemon almost couldn't hold back his amusement anymore. Quick as a flash, he placed the pillow back on the bed, before Davis turned back towards him.

"Well, I'm off to school now," he said. "Just don't forget to put some clothes on. Okay, Veemon?"

"Yeah, I got it, Davis," said Veemon, straining to keep up his calm facade.

"Alright then!" said Davis as he walked out of the room. "See you after school!" Veemon heard the front door open and close.

Veemon quickly ran over to the window and looked outside. It wasn't long before he could see Davis walk out into the street.

To Veemon, the entire scene was absurd; although Davis clearly passed by a bunch of people down at the street, not one of those people as much as lifted an eyebrow, when the 11-year old nude boy wearing just a backpack, passed by them. Everyone in the world, apart from Veemon, just found it perfectly normal!

Upon seeing this, Veemon could no longer restrain himself. He fell on his back and roared with laughter as he rolled around on the floor, guffawing hysterically like he had just been told the funniest joke of all time.

'UNBELIEVEABLE!!!' he thought between bursts of laughter. 'Not one of the humans down there spared a second glance at Davis; even though he was walking around buck-naked!!! I love this Change Stone!!!'

Finally composing himself, Veemon got back on his feet.

'Well, that was fun,' he thought. 'But now that the fun is over, I'd better get down to buissness. Because I used the Stone to alter reality, I'm the one who's supposed to wear clothes now. The only question now is: what should I wear?'

Looking around the room, Veemon could clearly see that there was no shortage of choices, as far as clothes were concerned.

'Oh boy,' thought Veemon. 'This might be harder than I thought. Davis' clothes - or, I guess technically MY clothes now - are spread all over the room.' Veemon shook his head. 'I think I'd better get everything sorted first. Then, I can decide what to wear. Man, it's gonna be though getting used to saying that!'

After about half-an-hour, Veemon had had finally managed to sort all of the clothing; with underwear in one pile, T-shirts in another, ect. Seperate from those piles, were the three outfits he had chosen to maybe try on first.

The first outfit was simply the white T-shirt and the dark blue boxers that Davis had previously worn. Veemon had chosen that, because since there were only two articles of clothing there, it would be the easiest for him to get used to wearing.

The second outfit was the soccer clothes. Since there were a few more articles of clothing in that set, Veemon figured it would be good for a second-stage try-out.

The third outfit was a full set of Davis' regular clothes. Consisting of a dark blue shirt with long sleeves and a thick white stripe across the chest and thin yellow stripes over and under it, a T-shirt in the same colours, a pair of blue boxers, a blue short-sleeved open vest, dark brown shorts, dark blue socks, orange and white boots, and of course the silver-white goggles, it was the most extensive of the three outfits. Though Veemon eventually wanted to try on this outfit in particular, he did think that there were perhaps a little too much clothing there for him to start off with; especially concidering he had never worn any clothes before.

'Whew, now THAT was a chore!' thought Veemon. 'Davis should really keep more order in his clothes. Although, since I used the Change Stone, I guess it's me who'll have to keep it all in order, which I just did.' He looked at the three outfits. 'But more on that later. What I have to concentrate on now, is deciding which of these sets of clothes I should try on first.'

Which set of clothes does Veemon decide to try on first?
155312121222222112.title: Veemon's though decisions...

choices: No. He sticks with the soccer uniform
Yes. He decided to wear the full set of clothes instead
1553121212222221121.content:
After carefully thinking it through, Veemon came to a decision.

'I think I'd better get used to wearing these things a little at a time,' thought Veemon. 'After all, I've never worn clothes before, so I don't know what it feels like.' He looked down at the three sets of clothes he had picked. 'That's why I'd better try on the T-shirt and the boxers first. Once I've gotten used to wearing that, I can try on more clothes.'

Veemon went over to the first set of clothes. Picking up the dark blue boxers, Veemon thought: 'Well, I wanted this, so I'd better do it.'

Putting his legs through the correct holes in the boxers, Veemon attempted to put them on, but found that he couldn't. As it turned out, his tail was preventing from wearing the boxers properly. Well, as properly as a little dragon Digimon could wear a pair of human-sized boxers.

"Oh, come on!" Veemon exclaimed out loud in frustration. He continued mentally: 'I can't believe I can't get these things on! It's the whole reason I even made that change! Wait a minute...' Veemon had to slap himself in face. 'I nearly forgot about the Change Stone!!! It can help with this! And I know just how...'

Veemon walked over to the Change Stone and picked it up. The change he implemented this time, was that whenever he would try on any articles of clothing that went on the legs, the clothes in question would gain an extra hole for him to put his tail through and the tail-hole would dissappear when Veemon wasn't wearing them.

Veemon saw the flash that indicated the change had been completed. Taking the Stone with him, Veemon laid it down on the floor next to him, as he once again tried to put on the boxers. This time, he saw the tail-hole appear on the boxers; the only problem was that the tail-hole appeared on the side of the boxers that was on Veemon's front. That's when Veemon realized that he had tried to put on the boxers the wrong way around!

Blushing profusely, Veemon quickly flipped the boxers so they were the right way around, while thinking: 'Oops! I guess I still have much to learn about clothes!'

This time, Veemon successfully managed to put on the boxers, by putting his tail through the new hole. This also had the added benefit of preventing the, for Veemon, oversized boxers from falling off of him.

'Whoa!' thought Veemon. 'I know this is the first time I'm wearing clothes of any kind, but still... It feels really weird to wear these.' The sentation of wearing clothes was certainly new and odd to Veemon.

He had deliberately chosen to place the clothes and himself in front of the mirror in Davis' room, so he could see how he looked with clothes on. As it turned out, he looked as weird as he thought the boxers felt.

While the boxers would be normal-sized on Davis' body, they would be able to count as proper pants on Veemon's much smaller body.

'Boy, do I look ridiculous wearing Davis' - or should that be my now - underwear!' thought Veemon with a grin. 'But there's still one thing missing.'

Veemon picked up the T-shirt from the floor. Having learned from trying to put the boxers on backwards, Veemon checked the inside for the mark to see which was the front and which was the back.

Having found out which was which on the T-shirt, Veemon proceded to put it on. It was easy enough; he had seen Davis put it on many times, so he knew which holes he should put his head and arms into. With him now wearing the T-shirt, Veemon looked at himself in the mirror again.

'Boy; I look even more ridiculous wearing this!' thought the grinning Veemon. Indeed it did; the T-shirt was so big on him, that it covered his whole body, exept for his feet!

Still grinning, Veemon turned so he could see how he looked from the side. He saw that the bottom back edge of his new T-shirt was hanging over his tail, causing his new boxers to be visible underneath.

'This is just plain crazy!' thought Veemon. 'Even though it is unnatural for a Digimon of my species to wear any form of clothing, I'm wearing it because everyone else thinks that's normal. And all because of that Change Stone!'

Veemon looked down at his now-clothed body. 'Actually, since I altered reality with that Stone, I HAVE to wear clothes! Otherwise, it'd be considered unethical. That doesn't stop it from feeling weird, though...' Veemon had to resist the urge to remove the clothes; this was how it HAD to be, in this altered reality.

'Maybe it's because the clothes are still human-sized,' thought Veemon, 'but they feel really weird to wear.' Veemon tugged on his new T-shirt. 'It's like I'm wrapped up in a set of drapes, that I have to walk around in, too.' Veemon let go of the T-shirt. 'That reminds me; I need to know if I can even walk around wearing this, or if I have to use the Change Stone again.'

Veemon tried to move around while still wearing the slightly uncomfortable clothes. Although the clothes were a bit cumbersome, because of their size, Veemon managed to walk, run and jump around relatively normal. There was only one little downside.

'Okay, so I can move around like I normally do,' thought Veemon. 'But it did feel weird to do it with clothes on.' Veemon gently tugged on both his new T-shirt and his new boxers to better look at them. 'While the clothes didn't exactly inhibit my movements, the feeling of their fabric brushing against my body as I moved, was outright bizzare!'

Veemon released his grip on the clothes. 'It's a good thing that I first chose to swap clothes with Davis, instead of swapping our bodies,' he thought. 'If I'd had to wear them in Davis' body, without getting used to them first, altered reality or not, someone would have gotten suspicious.'

Looking at his reflection in the mirror again, Veemon thought: 'I still look ridiculous in this, but I'm the only one who knows that.' He shifted his wiew from the mirror, to the two other sets of clothes on the floor. 'But, as silly as I look wearing this, it's only the most basic set of clothes. I need to try out the other sets too.'

Walking over to the clothes, Veemon selected the soccer uniform as the next thing he would try. But before that, he used the Change Stone again.
