155331121.content:
It was a beautiful Saturday morning. Inside the Thorndyke Mansion, Chris was waking up. He'd been sleeping a little longer than usual, even by his weekend standards, because he had the whole house to himself today.

His parents had decided to invite the whole house, including Sonic and his friends, to the set of his mother's newest film. Chris had politely declined; he'd been on such tours many times before.

That's why he was alone today. Sonic and the others wouldn't be back until evening.

Chris yawned, streched and got out of bed. But before he could do anything else, a bright light and a wooshing sound came from outside and attracted his attention.

"What's going on here?" he said to himself and walked over to the window. He'd barely made it over there, before the light and the noise became a lot more intense. A few seconds later the light and the noise vanished, as something impacted on his lawn.

"Woah! What was that?" exclaimed Chris. Still wearing his light-blue pyjamas, Chris hurried outside to see what had crashed down.

When he got there, he saw that whatever had crashed into the ground had left a small crater from the impact. Looking into the crater, he saw what appeared to be a Chaos Emerald laying there.

"That's weird," said Chris to himself. "What is a Chaos Emerald doing here?"

He reached out to touch the Emerald. The moment he did, his head was filled with information about it. Appearently it wasn't one of the Chaos Emeralds, but a different kind called a Change Emerald. According to the new information in his head, this Emerald had the abillity to change/transform/alter whatever and whoever the holder of the Emerald wanted to, with no limits.

As soon as the flow of information stopped, Chris went over it in his head. Being of a scientific mind, he was rather sceptical about the capabillities of this Change Emerald. He figured it was best to test it out first, but he was reluctant to use himself as the guiniapig, at least not yet. Instead, he looked around the yard for a better target...

His eyes were drawn to a tiny little bird, small enough to fit in the palm of his hand, flittering around bushes.

'Well, here goes nothing...' thought Chris, as he gripped the Emerald firmly and concentrated on what should happen to the bird.

There was a quick flash of light from the Emerald. When it died down, Chris saw that the little bird was now inside a birdcage!

"Whoah! That actually worked!" Chris was so surprised that he said it out loud.

Looking at the Emerald again, Chris thought: 'So, this thing is not some kind of joke, or a trap by Eggman! It actually does change everything however I want it!'

Chris didn't spend much time thinking about what he should do next. Grabbing the birdcage, he hurried back up to his own room.

The bird didn't mind the sudden speed; in fact, it was surprisingly calm about the whole thing. That was because Chris didn't only want the bird to be in a cage; he also wanted it to be a domesticated bird that could be kept as a pet, instead of something like a canary.

When he came back to his room, Chris gently placed the birdcage on the table he had in there. He then walked over and stood in front of his mirror.

'Now that I know that the Change Emerald is the real deal,' he thought, 'I'd like to know, if it can change me too. Nothing too big though; I just want to make sure that it can alter living things too. But, how do I best test it out? And what should I change?'

As Chris stood and thought hard about what he should try changing on himself, his eyes fell on the reflection of his new bird. Then he got an idea.

'This could be an interesting experiment to try. I think I'll do it!" decided Chris.

Once more gripping the Emerald tightly, Chris thought about the change he wanted to happen. When the Emerald flashed, Chris closed his eyes. He could feel the change taking place, causing him to be disoriented for a moment. When the weird feeling had passed, he opened his eyes again and looked at his reflection in the mirror.

Although he knew what he had changed and was prepared for what he would see, he was still surprised by the sight.

He was still mostly himself; a 12-year old boy in a light-blue pyjamas. The only thing wrong about that reflection, was his head. Because it was no longer his head, nor was it even a human head. Instead, he now had the head of a bird, on top of his human body!

But it wasn't just any bird's head; it was an exact copy of the head of the bird in the cage! Furthermore, it was also the same exact size as the original, meaning that Chris' new bird-head was ridiculously undersized on his human body!

Chris just stared at his new bird-head for a few moments.

'Unbelievable!' thought Chris. 'I can't believe that actually worked! This Change Emerald is amazing!'

Chris leaned forward slightly to get a better look at his new head. The first thing he noticed, was that his neck had also shrunk to better fit in size to his new bird-head.

The second thing he noticed, was that he had to pull down the collar of his pyjamas slightly, so he could look at his reflection. Otherwise, because of the size of his new bird-head, the top of the pj's would have obscured his line of sight.

The third thing he noticed, was that because of the tiny bird-head that he now had, everything seemed to be a lot bigger than usual; the mirror, his bed, the table, even his own body! When he looked to one side or the other, he could see the high collar of his pyjamas completely blocking his line of sight to his shoulders; his bird-head was THAT small!

Slowly, Chris brought one of his hands up to his new head. It looked like the hand belonged to a giant, to his bird-eyes. Very carefully, he used one of his fingers to stroke his bird-head. It was a very odd sensation, feeling his new tiny feathers being simultaniously stroked by his finger, and feeling the feathers under his human hand. He also marveled at the seamless transition between feathers and skin.

After some more marveling, Chris decided to do something else. 'I can't just stand here and look at my new head all day. I'd better change back, so I can get my clothes on.' He was just about to change back to normal with the Emerald, when he had a funny thought.

'You know, maybe I shouldn't change back just yet. I think it's actually fun to have the head of a bird. But I don't want to stay like this forever; just for a little while.' Chris thought more about it. 'I think I'll keep my bird-head until I've gotten my clothes on. That seems like a fitting amount of time.'

Having decided what to do, Chris made to walk over to his closet, only to stumble and fall down on his stomach right away.

'Hey, why did I fall down?' thought Chris, as he picked himself up, or tried to. He answered his own question, when he realized that it was more difficult for him to get up.

'Of course!' thought Chris. 'Because of my tiny head, my hight- and depth-perceptions are all wrong! I'll have to try and adjust to this...'

Slowly and clumsily, Chris got back on his feet. His theory was correct; because he had a tiny bird-head on top of his normal-sized human body, the size difference between them, was messing both with his line of sight and his sense of balance. This was clearly appearent as he moved over to his closet to get his clothes; he had to walk very slowly and wobbley, swaying his arms around just to keep his balance.

When he finally made it to his closet, it took him a bit longer to find his clothes than normal, because his bird-head was so tiny.

'Okay, so it's a bit harder than I thought', Chris admitted to himself. 'Walking around with the head of a bird, instead of my own, is definitely weird and just feels bizzare! But, I made a decision and I am sticking to it.'

As soon as he found his clothes, Chris made his way back to his bed, still walking awkwardly. When he got there, the first thing he did was to take off his pyjamas. It was a little thougher for him to do it, because of his bird-head and when he removed the pyjama-shirt, he also had to make sure that his new beak didn't snag on the fabric.

Before he put on his regular clothes, Chris couldn't resist taking another look at himself in the mirror. He thought it was even funnier than the last time; a tiny little bird-head on top of human body, only wearing a pair of tighty-whities. The whole thing looked so absurd!

With that distraction out of the way, Chris proceeded to putting on his clothes, which was a bit of a challenge because of his bird-head.

Because of his altered line of sight, Chris had to stand in front of the mirror, ib order to put on his jeans; otherwise he would have been unable to do it right. When he put on his long-sleaved T-shirt, and his short-sleaved shirt, he once more had to be careful that new beak wouldn't get stuck in the fabric. He also had to stand in front of the mirror to put on his socks and shoes.

Chris was quite amazed with himself. 'I actually managed to put on my clothes, while having the head of a bird!' he thought. 'But, as fun as it was, I'd better get back to normal now.'

Using the Emerald, he did just that and he was actually glad to have his own human head back on his shoulders. But one question remained: should he try uding the Emerald some more, or wait and let Tails have a look at it, when he comes back?

Natsu grumbled as he pulled more weeds out of the ground. The reason why he was doing this gardening job, and not something fun and great like a guarding job, or an extermination was because of a. . .accident that happened during his last job. How was he supposed to know that his fire would accidentally spread to the noble's house, and burn it down, and accidentally send said noble to the hospital. Ever since then Master Makarov wanted Natsu to lay low for a little bit until it all blown over.

"Careful there," A woman started. "Make sure you don't pull out any of my plants out." She then advised. You wouldn't want me to take it out of your bill now would you?" She soon reminded.

"Yeah yeah," Natsu muttered angrily.

The job contractor was an older woman with fair skin in her mid to late 30's. She had a long red hair that went down to her mid-back and purple eyes. She had a beautiful heartshape face with dignifying lines of age on her face. She had a curvy sexual body that oozed maturity with large ripe breasts that put the younger woman of Fairy Tail to shame, even though they just had a hint of sag to them, and wide child-bearing hips, and a large butt to go with it.

"Hey don't take that attitude with me!" The contractor ordered.

"Well sorry if I really don't want to be on this job old lady!" Natsu declared.

Old lady! Don't take that attitude with me you brat!" She roared. "And I'll have you know that they're still plenty of young men that want to be with me!"

"Like that's true you old hag!" Natsu snarled back. "As if any guy would want to be with a woman your age!" He then remarked.

"Oh so you think that just because I'm an older woman means that I can't get anyone's attention do you?" She asked as her hair rose up, and resembled nine tails.

"Y-Yeah right!" Natsu remarked with a false bravado. He wouldn't admit being afraid of her, even though she kind of reminded him of Erza.

The woman then went and cracked her knuckles in a menacing matter.

Natsu shivered as he realized that he bit off more then he could chew.

The woman smirked in delight in his fear and unleashed her magical power. She let loose a powerful punch that hit Natsu right in the jawline, sending him flying.

"OW!" Natsu roared with a flame coming out of his mouth. "What the hell lady!?" He then added.

"Oh please you deserved it for what you said, and besides your whining over a love tap," she said.

"So you decided to hit me for what I said!"

"Would you like me to hit you again?" She questioned while preparing her fist again.

Natsu winced to that as he looked at the red haired woman before scuffing. "Yeah right, Erza hit's way harder." He then stated.

"Oh then you won't mind if I stop holding back then," she said.

"Bring it on!" Natsu then roared while bursting into flames.

"Oh you're really gonna try and hit your client?" She asked, smirking.

"I never back down from a fight!" Natsu declared.

"Alright then," She said smirking as she placed one hand on her wide hip, and several rings appeared on her fingers.

"I'm all fired up!" Natsu declared.

"Alright then brat, but you're going to regret it by the end," she said.

At that point, the two then rushed at one another. Natsu threw the first punch and she easily dodged to the left and his other fist. Natsu kept trying to hit her, but every time he tried, and just like before she easily managed to dodge it.

"Well, I was expecting more from the Salamender of Fairy Tail." The woman remarked in a teasing tone.

That however got Natsu pissed. "SHUT UP! NO ONE INSULTS FAIRY TAIL!" He roared as the fire around him grew larger.

Natsu however was too into a blind rage to hear what was stated.

The woman merely sighed to that as her rings were now glowing pink. "I guess you'll need to be taught some manners then." She soon stated. "Ancient Magic!" She began.

Natsu meanwhile charged forward and raised his fist, again, but unlike before she raised her hand this time to block.

"REFORMATION!" The woman declared as she and Natsu were engulfed in a pillar of light.

The year: 1888. The place: London, England. Jonathon Joestar and his adopted brother Dio have been attempting to get along ever since their fight in 1881. Despite their seemingly good spirit, tensions boil beneath the surface.

"Damn you, Jojo!" Dio thought to himself. "If you weren't in the picture, the Joestar fortune would be all mine and I wouldn't have to deal with such a worthless brat."

"Do," thought Jonathon. "Ever since we were children we've been fighting each other. I can never forgive you for killing my dog Danny, but as a gentleman, I can't turn him away. But I can't trust him either."

Yet the rivals shared common interests, from sports to intellectual pursuits. The two built a small collection of mysterious items, from the stone mask to mystical items that allegedly altered those that used it.

Ridiculous, of course, but the idea ruminated in their minds...

15533222222222222222222222221111.content:
Jonathon looked over the family's collection in pride. "We've built up quite an admirable collection. Wouldn't you say so, Dio?"

Dio made a dismissive noise as he glanced over their latest art piece. He had better things to do than listen to Jojo's inane prattling.

Damn it, what could he do to make Dio get along with him? Jonathon pressed the issue. "I mean, these goblets you discovered are incredible. They must be thousands of years old."

"It doesn't take a genius to find good art," he responded in a biting tone.

"I was just complimenting you-"

Dio turned around angrily, seven years of micro-aggression suddenly reaching his boiling point. "I don't need your stupid compliments, Jojo!"

Jonathon could only grapple with this sudden anger before giving it back twofold. "Do you ever stop being so arrogant? You can't even take a compliment like a gentleman before flying off the handle!"

Dio lunged at Jonathon, only for the towering man of muscle to slap a punch into his face. The blonde aristocrat was pushed into a table. He couldn't let Jojo beat him, not again! His fingers gripped around one of the goblets, recently filled with water, and threw it towards Jojo. The water splashed all over Jonathon.

Before the Joestar could make another move, a wave of dizziness overcame him. He struggled to keep his balance. Something was different, but what?

1553322222222222222222222222111111.content:
Jonathan, famous among the locals for his sheer strength, marveled as his muscles shrunk. The giant of a man was shrinking inch by inch until whatever strange demand the magical goblet was making found Jonathon to be at a suitable height.

His hips pushed outward slightly as his waist contracted. His upper body was similarly warping, abs shifting into something considerably softer and less imposing. Other changes were taking place in his trousers, ones that he could hardly bars to imagine. Hair vanished from his arms and legs, as his locks grew and extended to reach the edge of his shoulders.

Jonathon was positive the transformation had finished, but his clothes had other ideas. His dress pants flowed and shifted, each leg attaching to the other before suddenly bursting into the shape of a skirt. His undergarments shrunk snugly to provide support for Jojo's new cleavage. His shirt softened and twisted about as a series of frills overtook the collar. With the final attachment to the skirt, the lady Joestar stood before Dio Brando in a dress.

Stumbling to a table, Jonathon picked up a mirror and gazed into the reflection. The woman had some muscles left over, sure. And the hair was just short enough to be considered boyish but it was also too long to belong to anything but a girl. The soft face and the dress and everything else... "This can't be possible..." gasped a light, feminine voice from her lips.

Dio began to laugh as his shock transformed into delight, soon cackling in outrageous amusement. "Believe it, Jojo! The only explanation for this miracle is the Goblets of Change. Even I didn't believe the legends of magical, body changing drinking glasses. But the evidence before us is to clear to deny! I would have splashed you a long time ago if I knew the result would be this amusing!"

Jonathan spun around to stare at Dio. "Amusing?! Dio, we need to change me back!"

"I can't allow that Jojo! With you in this form, the Joestar fortune will undoubtably fall into my possession! No office in England would decide otherwise! Face it Jojo! You've lost!"

Rage overtook the Joestar as she lifted her fist to slam into Dio. He effortlessly caught her hand and pulled her toward him, making sure her struggles were hopeless.

"A hit from you would still hurt me, I have no doubt. I've learned not to doubt the strike of you ever since our fight seven years ago!" A smirk rose. "But there's no use, Jojo! Even you can't fight the power of the Goblets! After all..."

As if on cue, a maid entered the room. Dio quickly released Jonathon and played the role of a gentleman. Jonathon could only stumble backward.

"Oh, master Dio, mistress Joanna, I didn't know you were in here," the maid apologized pleasantly. "I just came in to dust."

"That's alright Nancy," Dio added quickly as Jonathon struggled to form words. "We'll let you know when we're done in here."

The maid nodded politely and left the two on their own. Jonathon, traumatized beyond all belief, turned to see Dio's smug expression.

"That's right, Jojo. Only I know that you used to be strong, humble, Jonathon Joestar and not the polite, demure Joanna Joestar. And with that knowledge, I will keep you from returning to your natural form to secure my grasp on the fortune."

Jonathon was in no mood to fight, too shocked to respond, but she gave Dio an icy stare that struck him at his core. "I won't let you get away with this, Dio! No matter how long it takes!"

Tch. Always so persistent, that stupid Jonathon! He'd shut down that prideful oaf for good.

Diane Brando's new mind cemented itself. Villainy and anger melted away from her face as a warm smile appeared. She quickly grasped Joanna's hands.

Joanna smile softly. "I know exactly how you feel. It's so much more peaceful this way."

Now she needed to work subtly, make a sly remark here and there, play the defenseless maiden who no one suspected. Keep the attention off herself and let fools accept the blame.

The mask of an epiphany appeared. "Oh, my dear sister! How I've wronged you! I realize now how much happier I will be like this. Thank you, Joanna. I hope you can forgive me for what I've done."

Joanna knew Dio. Dio was a cad, evil in human form, manipulative beyond all compare, and a villain to the core. That sort of evil could never vanish, not while a trace of the man still remained.

But both Jonathon and Joanna were hopeful. Perhaps, one day, Diane could turn over a new leaf. Perhaps she already had and Joanna was just being paranoid. How could she call herself an honorable lady if she didn't give Diane that chance?

"Of course I forgive you. I always wanted a sister I could trust. I will happily accept you."

Diane smiled warmly, barely hiding her disdain. Foolish Joanna. Soon her naivety would be her doom.

The year is 1989. Jotaro Kujo has discovered his unique power, a spirit known as a "Stand". While his stand, Star Platinum, had given him extraordinary abilities, the stand of his mother is slowly killing her. Now he's in a race against time as he journeys to Egypt. There, the vampire Dio waits, sending other stand users to stop Jotaro and his friends from reaching him.

The Stardust Crusaders find themselves time to relax in the middle of their journey.

"We need to keep up our energy," Jotaro's grandfather Joseph demanded. "We can't fight Dio if we don't take care of ourselves."

Jotaro pulled on his hat irritably. Good grief. He was pretty sure his grandpa just wanted an excuse to check the local theaters and malls. Avdol and Kakyoin didn't object though and Polnareff was all too eager for a break as well.

"Be careful everyone," Avdol insisted. "Dio's servants could be around any corner."

Little did our heroes know that one of Dio's servants was lying in wait.

"Khehehehe. Those fools don't suspect a thing! Soon me and my stand "Bodies and Minds" will make short work with them!"

And with his plan ready, the stand user began to follow one of the heroes.

15533222222222222222222222221221.content:
The time: 1999. The place: Morioh. A small town in northeastern Japan, it's notable for its many landmarks. For example, a strangely shaped rock nicknamed Anjuro Rock became a popular meeting place for young lovers. Trattoria Trussardi is a similarly famous Italian restaurant in the area, run by its only employee Tonio Trussardi. They say anyone who eats his delicious food with find themselves healed of any ailment within minutes.

What many don't know is that these landmarks are often caused by the presence of Stand users, citizens with strange powers that defy imagination. More Stand users feel compelled to encounter each other in Morioh and thus strange occurrences have only continued to build.

On this particular day, Tonio was sick. He'd been up all night coughing and hacking and generally feeling miserable. Normally, he wouldn't dare come into work like this. But the fear of losing a customer, the possibility of someone coming to enjoy food only to be disappointed at me at his mind. So he arrived and performed his duties as usual, although this time with even more frequent hand washing and a mask to cover his mouth.

Had Tonio chosen to close his business for today, perhaps he and his stand Pearl Jam wouldn't have created a meal that failed to heal his customer. Instead, his customer would be changed in ways even Tonio couldn't expect.

But who was it that came to Tonio's restaurant?

He'd been hoping that Tonio's Pearl Jam stand might be able to fix up the old man's memory, just a little, but it looked like that wasn't on the table. He had always thought being the lovechild of some realtor mogul would be a hassle, but he still wished that father was easier to talk to. 155332222222222222222222222221211.content:
The plan was a total success. With the power of the Pretty Girl Drug, Iyami and Chibita were easily able to con those stupid sextuplets out of their cash.

Chibita had to admit though, he had some reservations. He didn't really hold a grudge against the Matsus the way Iyami did. It was kind of sad to see them fail to grow into adulthood like they should. Plus, he was spending a lot of time away from his oden shop and more and more time playing Rental Girlfriend. Still, he was making good cash.

Iyami, on the other hand, was over the moon. Not only was he getting his revenge on the Matsus, he was making a nice chunk of change, building a pile of dough, lining his pockets with gold. And the money he was earning wasn't bad either. Soon, with all the checks he'd cashed and the presents he'd gotten refunded, he wouldn't need to worry about money for a while. He could get an apartment again!

Today's excursion was already putting Iyami in a good mood. "Me can't wait to see what those Matsus give the girls today!"

Chibita rolled his eyes. "You idjit. We're gonna get caught sooner or later."

With a smooth movement, Iyami wrapped his arm around his partner in crime. "Don't worry, don't worry, zansu! Soon they'll run out of cash, and then we'll be set for life."

Chibita wasn't so sure, but couldn't come up with an argument otherwise. So he simply shoved the Frenchman off of him before stuffing a pill into his own mouth.

Iyami grinned as a light flashed around Chibita, before consuming his own drug sample. In an instant, large teeth shrunk to a perfect, shiny smile. Hair lightened into a blonde as his thin figure transformed into a stunning hourglass shape. Even his smirk looked more like a welcoming smile.

Chibita's virtually hairless dome became a pair of soft, pigtails. Eyelashes highlighted an adorable expression and his whiskers became subtler, more catlike. His short, unathletic figure was now petite and cute.

Even the clothes of the two men changed into a flattering ensemble that fit their new forms easily.

Iyayo flipped her hair back. "You ready for our dates? I know I am."

Chibimi giggled. "Definitely. It'll go great!

info.brief_description: The characters from your favorite anime undergo changes.
info.description:
Transform the characters of your favorite anime. Physically, mentally, etc. Sex is allowed, but please try to keep it to a minimum, and don't make it descriptive. And don't end the story.

Have fun.
